p.k: The Brazilian state of Amazonas, a vast territory bordering Brazil, concentrate the beauty of the Amazon and an Eldorado for many travelers. Over water, Christophe Cousin sets out to meet these men who are confronted with a last truly wild places of our planet. What drives inhabitants of this side of the world to navigate the waters of rivers? Trade, thirst gold, fish, religion, or perhaps this feeling of having succeeded in creating, middle of the green hell, a little corner of Eden?
